meanings.definition: Happening or occurring every night at midnight.
meanings.sent1: The midnightly train always passes by my house at the same time.
meanings.sent2: The midnightly ritual of stargazing brought peace to her mind.
meanings.sent3: The midnightly owl hooted loudly, interrupting the silence of the night.
meanings.sent4: The midnightly stars twinkled like diamonds in the dark sky.
meanings.sent5: The midnightly routine of checking the locks before bed became a comforting habit.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of midnight.
meanings.sent1: The midnightly sky was filled with twinkling stars and a bright moon.
meanings.sent2: The midnightly silence enveloped the town, creating a sense of calm.
meanings.sent3: The midnightly snack of warm milk and cookies was a delightful treat.
meanings.sent4: The midnightly fog draped the streets in a mysterious cloak.
meanings.sent5: The midnightly howl of a distant wolf echoed through the forest.

meanings.sent1: She checked her phone midnightly to see if he had messaged her.
meanings.sent2: The old clock chimed midnightly, signaling the start of a new day.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed midnightly, demanding to be let out into the garden.
meanings.sent4: The streetlight flickered midnightly, casting eerie shadows on the pavement.
meanings.sent5: The security guard patrolled the building midnightly, ensuring all was safe and sound.
